metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28447 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description: Smarty is a template engine for PHP. In affected versions smarty did not properly escape javascript code. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the context of the user's browser session. This may lead to unauthorized access to sensitive user data, manipulation of the web application's behavior, or unauthorized actions performed on behalf of the user. Users are advised to upgrade to either version 3.1.48 or to 4.3.1 to resolve this issue. There are no known workarounds for this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: civicrm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
postfixadmin: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
smarty3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
